data.title: Stunning Stadium
data.text: I need to go back, there was so much to take in and I wasn't able to do so in 1 trip.  Went to a Vikings game and the stadium is magnificent.  Super clean and friendly.

data.title: Bike this route
data.text: This is a great way to see scenic Minneapolis. I loved biking it and would recommend everyone to do this route.

data.title: A Wonderful Way to See Minneapolis on a Bike
data.text: Minneapolis is a very bike friendly town (except in winter) and the Grand Rounds byway is a great way to see many of the city's unique and beautiful sites, especially on a bike. There are many rental bikes available and the byway features detailed maps. You will get to experience the Mississippi River in multiple locations, Minnehaha Creek and the Falls, the Chain of Lakes and parts of downtown. At the Falls, I would recommend locking your bike and walking the trail below the Falls down to the River. Also plan to grab some ice cream (and maybe a summer music concert) at the north end of Lake Harriet. Plan on perhaps four hours to cover the entire byway at a reasonable pace.

data.title: Nice drive
data.text: Good trip around Minneapolis suburbs, view of homesites on lakes and access to parks.  can be a little hard to follow. the routes.

data.title: Fifty three miles of beauty
data.text: The Chain of Lakes and parks surrounding them are connected  not just by a series of canals. The lakes, parks, garden, bike paths, and walking trails are all surrounded with fifty three miles of the Grand Rounds Scenic Byway. The Byway passes through beautiful lakeside neighborhoods and encircles the city with love. We traveled the Byway in late summer and the flowers, fun, and families we saw made us feel like the City of Minneapolis cared about its future.

data.title: Personal Brewery Tour
data.text: Wonderful urban trail system that takes you through every environment of Minneapolis.  Well maintained paved trail that loops the city though the lakes, Minnehaha  Creek, The Big Muddy,  The U of M, Downtown, Inner NE and back to lakes and Uptown.  So much to see and do along the way you might need a game plan.

data.title: Great Place for a Walk
data.text: This is located near the sculpture garden, a set of restaurants and has among the most beautiful gardens in the city.  And don't forget the dandelion fountain.  It's also dog friendly if you'd like to take your pooch.

data.title: the best city biking anywhere
data.text: Love it! I do a 25 mile loop twice weekly. Scenic, beautiful. Great for residents and tourists.  gorgeous landscapes, architecture meets nature.

data.title: Multiple Bike Options
data.text: The Grand Rounds is a 70 mile (or so) series of biking trails in and around Minneapolis.  The beauty is you can ride any portion at any time.  The intersect and interconnect, so you can pick any length of ride, in numerous areas - lakes, downtown, river, woods.  Fun, as easy or challenging as you're feeling, and ready made for bikes.

data.title: Bike the City
data.text: This is a more challenging way to see Minneapolis.  Most of it is on asphalt trails, but there are a few places where one must bike on the street and the route can be a bit confusing.

data.title: One of the best ways to spend time on a good weather day
data.text: We recently enjoyed the Grand Rounds while on a Segway tour and this is a beautiful way to enjoy the riverfront on Minneapolis on a warm, sunny June day. Not only is there a lot of see and a lot of history, it's a clean and enjoyable way to spend some time outdoors. Make sure you walk across the Stone Arch Bridge, and if you work up a thirst (or appetite), hang out on one of the outdoor restaurant decks at St. Anthony Main.

data.title: Enjoyed most of it!
data.text: Road construction and bridges closed made it confusing to follow the route, but we enjoyed the stops we made made. We began at Minehaha Falls and enjoyed the downtown parks. Later, after abandoning the route, we ended up on Lake Harriet and enjoyed a park bench! I wish the signs were easier to read, and we would have liked a paper map.

data.title: Need better signage in places
data.text: We had a perfect day of biking this trail but got lost a few times when it wasn't well-marked.  It also was quite crowded on a Saturday.  Beautiful views, though!

data.title: Lovely walk around the lake
data.text: 3 miles of clean and uncluttured walk around the lake. Do some dog watching as well on a good day as it seems there are as many dogs as humans!

data.title: Get on a bike and get outside
data.text: Plenty of bike rental places at various lakes and local bike shops. The trail is well marked, paved, smooth and free of cars, which makes for a great ride. You could go for 200 miles on the vast network of trails for bikes or just go for 5 miles and get a taste of the scenery. Superb cycling infrastructure in the Minneapolis metro region.

data.title: Minneapolis icon. Urban landscape architecture at its best.
data.text: One of the hallmarks of the Minneapolis experience. A series of parks and lakes create environmental greenspaces in the city. A national treasure, a real model of urban planning.

data.title: The Grand Rounds are Amazing!
data.text: We are so lucky to have this wonderful selection of connected trails that connect the lakes, the river and the falls to the rest of the city.  From the Grand Rounds via bike you can get anywhere in the city of Minneapolis.  With the Nice Ride bikes there is a great opportunity for visitors to Minneapolis to explore the trails and really see all the beautiful places Minneapolis has to offer.  Get a map or just follow the signs, it is pretty easy to get around!

data.title: Beautiful Byway
data.text: Great byway for traveling by bike and makes the time fly when commuting and taking in the sights around.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: Love this park.  Hot summer day, beautiful fountain, walking paths, fishing, cycling, basketball.  What more could you ask for in the heart of the city.

data.title: Wonderful trails
data.text: The Grand Rounds are wonderful trails throughout the Twin Cities. They are beautiful and well maintained
